info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elbert and southwestern Abbeville Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Abbeville, or near Calhoun Falls, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Calhoun Falls, Lowndesville, Lake Strom Thurmond, Lake Russell, Middleton, Bobby Brown State Park, Russell State Park, Richard B Russell Dam and Rice Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
